page.title: 12Interview with R.Halling
page.content: We had an interview with Richard Halling who has been a councillor and a mayor and a school governor. Now he is a bookmaker in Tring. We asked him some questions. Q"How many years were you involved with Tring council?"A"I should think about 10 to 12 years."Q" How long were you a mayor for?"A"It has been the tradition in Tring that you are a mayor for 1 year."Q"Why did you choose to become a bookmaker?"A"When I was young I went to the fair,I spent all my money on pony rides so when I grew up that was as close as I could get to horses."Q"How long have you been a citizen of Tring?"A" About 24 years."Q"Did the people have to vote for you to become mayor"A"Yes, but not directly.The public elect 12 councillors and the councillors vote for the mayor."
